verses.text_plain: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
verses.verse_html: 1Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

verses.text_plain: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!
verses.verse_html:
2As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence! ▼
▼ the melting…: Heb. the fire of meltings

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the melting…: Heb. the fire of meltings
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the melting…: Heb. the fire of meltings

verses.text_plain: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.
verses.verse_html: 3When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

verses.text_plain: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.
verses.verse_html:
4For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him. ▼
▼ seen…: or, seen a God beside thee, which doeth so for him, etc

tokens.text: For since the beginning of the world

footnotes.body_text: ▼ seen…: or, seen a God beside thee, which doeth so for him, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ seen…: or, seen a God beside thee, which doeth so for him, etc

verses.text_plain: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.
verses.verse_html: 5Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

verses.text_plain: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
verses.verse_html: 6But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

tokens.text: But we are all as an unclean

verses.text_plain: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.
verses.verse_html:
7And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities. ▼
▼ consumed: Heb. melted
 , ▼
▼ because: Heb. by the hand

tokens.text: of thee: for thou hast hid

footnotes.body_html: ▼ because: Heb. by the hand

verses.text_plain: But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.
verses.verse_html: 8But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

verses.text_plain: Be not wroth very sore, O Lord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.
verses.verse_html: 9Be not wroth very sore, O Lord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

verses.text_plain: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
verses.verse_html: 10Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

verses.text_plain: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
verses.verse_html: 11Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

verses.text_plain: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
verses.verse_html: 12Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
